intro: Ilex amara f. microphylla, commonly known as the dwarf holly, is a compact evergreen shrub characterized by its small, glossy dark green leaves. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is native to the southeastern United States. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible for birds but toxic to humans and livestock. Its dense growth habit makes it suitable for use as a hedge or ornamental plant in gardens. The leaves remain evergreen throughout the year, providing year-round visual interest.
